ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 1017
ygData.msgSnippet: Without a doubt take out the dblue first.  The reasoning is that with less mobs up you have a better chance of running should you have to.  With multiple mobs
ygData.messageBody:
Without a doubt take out the dblue first. The
reasoning is that with less mobs up you have a better
chance of running should you have to. With multiple
mobs hitting you, there is more of a chance you will
be stunned should your health drop to a level you feel
that evasion is necessary.

The other reason is that the faster you can kill one
of the mobs, which will be the easier, then you can
focus uninterrupted dps on the harder mob.

One last thing to concider is that the LONGER you
fight the more chance of adds from wondering mobs.
Make the fights quick and manageable. If you kill the
easier, you can drag the harder one to where YOU want
him.

Dragowulf
Ronin Ranger of The Tribunal

> Message: 1
> Date: Thu, 24 Jun 2004 17:37:37 -0400
> From: "Wulfric Rennison" <wulftech@...>
> Subject: Re: Who do you take first?
>
> I am assuming by this narrative that you are a melee
> fighter and not a caster, and probably under level
> 10?
>
> If you are a melee fighter then I'd say go for the
> blue one. If you can kill him you'll at least get
> some xp before you die. If you are under 10 you
> won't lose xp so the xp you just got you still keep.
>
>
> If you are a caster try slowing
> /snaring/mezzing/rooting one or the other then pull
> the still mobile one away and kill him.
>
> In either case, its always good to have sow just inc
> ase you need to run if thigns go frm bad to worse.
>
> Now though if you get a Temp from a high level
> cleric, you can probably take on both orcs without
> losing too much health.
>
> Wulfric
>
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Techpriest
> To: EverQuest (E-mail)
> Sent: Wednesday, June 23, 2004 10:28 AM
> Subject: [EverQuest] Who do you take first?
>
>
> It happened again yesterday. I pick a fight with
> an orc that cons yellow,
> and a buddy of his joins in who cons blue. I am
> working solo so they are
> both my problem alone. I have been trying to
> figure out the best way to
> deal with them.
>
> Take the blue first since I can kill him quicker,
> thus I will recieve lets
> hits total during the fight?
>
> Take the yellow though it will take longer to kill
> him, and I am getting
> attacked by the blue the whole time, its the
> yellow one is doing the most
> damage so the less time I face him the better off
> I am.
>
> Or is it pretty much a wash either way?
> ----------
> Her, "Are you still making sandwiches?"
> Me, "No, now I am making tunics."
> Her, "And you make fun of Myst because of the lack
> of action!"
>
>
